title: 3 Easy Ways to Find and Remove Saved Cards on an iPhone

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the grey cog icon. You can delete cards saved in the Wallet app within your iPhone's settings. This can also be done in the app itself. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Wallet & Apple Pay.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Wallet & Apple Pay . This should be underneath App Store . You'll see a list of all your added payment methods underneath Payment Cards .

steps.title: Tap a card.
steps.content: Tap a card. You'll see the card's information, such as the last four digits, billing address, and latest transactions. For security purposes, you won't be able to reveal the card's full number. To view the card's transactions, tap the Transactions tab at the top.

steps.title: Tap Remove Card (optional).
steps.content: Tap Remove Card (optional). If you want to remove the payment method from the Wallet app, tap the red text at the bottom. You may be asked to confirm. This will remove the card from the Wallet app and Apple Pay . If you saved the card with your Apple ID , you'll need to remove it there as well.

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the grey cog icon. Use this method to delete payment cards saved to your Apple ID account.

steps.title: Tap your Apple ID.
steps.content: Tap your Apple ID. This is at the top of the page.

steps.title: Tap Payment & Shipping.
steps.content: Tap Payment & Shipping . You can find this underneath Sign In & Security . You may be asked to provide your device's passcode or Face ID .

steps.title: Tap a card.
steps.content: Tap a card. You'll see a list of your cards underneath Payment Methods .

steps.title: Tap Remove Payment Method (optional).
steps.content: Tap Remove Payment Method (optional). This will remove the card from your Apple ID. You may be asked to confirm.

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the grey cog icon. Use this method if you want to view or edit the saved card numbers suggested to you when you fill out forms in Safari.

steps.title: Tap Safari.
steps.content: Tap Safari . You can find this in the list of default iOS apps.

steps.title: Tap AutoFill.
steps.content: Tap AutoFill . This is underneath the General header.

steps.title: Tap Saved Credit Cards.
steps.content: Tap Saved Credit Cards . You can find this towards the bottom. If you want to stop Safari from filling out credit card information completely toggle off Credit Cards .

steps.title: Tap a card.
steps.content: Tap a card. If you have cards saved to Safari, you'll see it added underneath the Safari header.

steps.title: Tap Edit.
steps.content: Tap Edit . This is in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Delete (optional).
steps.content: Tap Delete (optional). This will remove the card from your AutoFill settings. If you don't want to delete the card, you can make changes to it instead.
